message.content:
Since $x$ and $y$ are inversely proportional, $xy=a$ for some constant $a.$ When $x=42-y$ and $x=2y,$ we have $xy=a=(42-y)(2y).$ Expanding the right side gives $2y^2-84y+a=0,$ so $y=\frac{-(-84)\pm\sqrt{(-84)^2-4(2)(a)}}{4}=\frac{84\pm\sqrt{7056+8a}}4.$ Since $a>0$ (inverse proportions are always positive unless $a=0$), the expression $\sqrt{7056+8a}$ is real, so $y=\frac{84\pm\sqrt{7056+8a}}4.$ When $x=-8,$ we have $xy=a=-8\cdot y=-8\left(\frac{84\pm\sqrt{7056+8a}}4\right).$ Since $a$ is positive,  $a=-8\left(\frac{84+\sqrt{7056+8a}}4\right),$ so substituting $a=(42-y)(2y),$ we get $-(42-y)(2y)=4(84+\sqrt{7056+8a}),$ which simplifies to
$$-84y+2y^2=336+4\sqrt{7056+8a}.$$Since $y$ is inversely proportional to $x,$ when $x=-8,$ $y$ is non-zero. Therefore, $y$ must be the positive part of $y=\frac{84+\sqrt{7056+8a}}4.$ Since the expression $\sqrt{7056+8a}$ must be real, it follows that $7056+8a=0,$ so we have $$y=\frac{84+\sqrt{7056}}4=\boxed{12}.$$
